subject: RE: How to start with JUnit [RE: [junit] a query]
msgSnippet: Hi, why you are using junit if your intention is not to write unit tests? Overall it sounds to be more a pure programming issue than a task of unit testing by
messageBody:
Hi,

why you are using junit if your intention is
not to write unit tests?

Overall it sounds to be more a pure programming
issue than a task of unit testing by itself.
Maybe it's better to ask how to call your api
and how to test it in general.

So don't missunderstand the purpose of junit and
unit testing at all.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of novice junit
> Sent: Montag, 7. April 2008 15:08
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: How to start with JUnit [RE: [junit] a query]
>
> Hello Martin,
>
> Thanks much for your inputs on my query. have skimmed through
> the junit cookbook and the junit faq's posted by this mailing
> list. however, not able to find out how should i begin with.
> I don't have to do unit testing. i am an QA engineer. my task
> is to automate my testing using junit .
>
> all I have is all the urls where these API are available and
> the query parameters that they take before they send
> response. The response can be in xml or json or php format.
> in fact In my http call to those, i have to suggest in which
> format response should be...(its one of the query string
> parameter in my request)
>
> once I get the response, parse them take some of the
> parameters (like say if I call the login API, i will get a
> session cookie which i have to send on consequent request)and
> build another request and call different API.
>
> Thanks again !
>
> please help.
>
> Cheers, S
>
> On Mon, Apr 7, 2008 at 4:00 PM, Böhm, Martin
> <martin.boehm@...
> <mailto:martin.boehm%40salt-solutions.de> >
> wrote:
>
> > Hi,
> >
> > first you should know, that you have to dig in more advanced junit
> > topics to cope with your task.
> >
> > For myself I read http://junit.sourceforge.net/
> > <http://junit.sourceforge.net/> and the JUnit-Cookbook as
> beginner.
> > It's a simple starting point to get into unittesting. Especially in
> > your case I would suggest you to get more acquainted with junit.
> >
> > A more advanced book that gives a very deep understanding of unit
> > tests I found in "xUnit Test Patterns"
> > (Gerard Meszaros). That should give you the real taste of junit
> > without suffering the common junit beginner pitfalls.
> >
> > In the second step you should be able to decide if you use
> pure junit
> > to take your task or to use a framework additional, that
> may simplify
> > some testing tasks in your environment, for example to test
> > http-communication.
> >
> > best regards
> > Martin
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: junit@yahoogroups.com
> <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> <junit%40yahoogroups.com> [mailto:
> > junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> > <junit%40yahoogroups.com>] On
> > > Behalf Of novice junit
> > > Sent: Sonntag, 6. April 2008 18:40
> > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > <junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > Subject: [junit] a query
> > >
> > > Hi all Pros
> > >
> > > I am new to junit and have a task at hand. i need to build an
> > > automation test suite using junit to test these API. the api's
> > > called using http request ( its like
> > > http://api.xyz.com?a=0&b=1&.c=1 <http://api.xyz.com?a=0&b=1&.c=1>
> > > <http://api.xyz.com?a=0&b=1&.c=1
> <http://api.xyz.com?a=0&b=1&.c=1> >
> > > etc...)and the response is returned in XML / json and php format.
> > >
> > > each response has to be parsed and take few of the
> parameters from
> > > the response and build a new http request and send it
> again. or call
> > > a different API with new param after I parse the first one.
> > > can anyone Suggest me any book, online doc etc for the same.
> > > and also get me started with this automation suite. how should I
> > > start with this task.
> > >
> > > any inputs will be very helpful.
> > >
> > > Thabk you very much !
> > >
> > > Cheers, S
> > >
> > > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
> >
